name: fastly
description: A Pulumi package for creating and managing fastly cloud resources.
attribution: This Pulumi package is based on the [`fastly` Terraform Provider](https://github.com/fastly/terraform-provider-fastly).

forceHttp2.description: Set this to `true` to disable HTTP/1.x fallback mechanism that the underlying Go library will attempt upon connection to `api.fastly.com:443` by default. This may slightly improve the provider's performance and reduce unnecessary TLS handshakes. Default: `false`

noAuth.description: Set to `true` if your configuration only consumes data sources that do not require authentication, such as `fastly.getFastlyIpRanges`

domains.description: Names of a subset of domains that the alert monitors.

origins.description: Addresses of a subset of backends that the alert monitors.

ignoreBelow.description: Threshold for the denominator value used in evaluations that calculate a rate or ratio. Usually used to filter out noise.

period.description: The length of time to evaluate whether the conditions have been met. The data is polled every minute. One of: `2m`, `3m`, `5m`, `15m`, `30m`.

type.description: Type of strategy to use to evaluate. One of: `above_threshold`, `all_above_threshold`, `below_threshold`, `percent_absolute`, `percent_decrease`, `percent_increase`.

dataSource.description: An object which describes the data to display.

id.description: Dashboard item identifier (alphanumeric). Must be unique, relative to other items in the same dashboard.

span.description: The number of columns for the dashboard item to span. Dashboards are rendered on a 12-column grid on "desktop" screen sizes.

subtitle.description: A human-readable subtitle for the dashboard item. Often a description of the visualization.

title.description: A human-readable title for the dashboard item.

visualization.description: An object which describes the data visualization to display.

config.description: Configuration options for the selected data source.

type.description: The source of the data to display. One of: `stats.edge`, `stats.domain`, `stats.origin`.

metrics.description: The metrics to visualize. Valid options are defined by the selected data source: [stats.edge](https://www.fastly.com/documentation/reference/api/observability/custom-dashboards/metrics/edge/), [stats.domain](https://www.fastly.com/documentation/reference/api/observability/custom-dashboards/metrics/domain/), [stats.origin](https://www.fastly.com/documentation/reference/api/observability/custom-dashboards/metrics/origin/).

config.description: Configuration options for the selected data source.

type.description: The type of visualization to display. One of: `chart`.

calculationMethod.description: The aggregation function to apply to the dataset. One of: `avg`, `sum`, `min`, `max`, `latest`, `p95`.

format.description: The units to use to format the data. One of: `number`, `bytes`, `percent`, `requests`, `responses`, `seconds`, `milliseconds`, `ratio`, `bitrate`.

plotType.description: The type of chart to display. One of: `line`, `bar`, `single-metric`, `donut`.

signal.description: Signal name to exclude (used when `type = exclude_signal`).

type.description: The action type. One of: `add_signal`, `allow`, `block`, `browser_challenge`, `dynamic_challenge`, `exclude_signal`, `verify_token` or for rate limit rule valid values: `log_request`, `block_signal`, `browser_challenge`, `verify_token`

field.description: Field to inspect (e.g., `ip`, `path`).

operator.description: Operator to apply (e.g., `equals`, `contains`).

value.description: The value to test the field against.

conditions.description: A list of nested conditions in this group.

groupOperator.description: Logical operator for the group. Accepted values are `any` and `all`.

field.description: Field to inspect (e.g., `ip`, `path`).

operator.description: Operator to apply (e.g., `equals`, `contains`).

value.description: The value to test the field against.

conditions.description: A list of nested conditions in this list.

field.description: Enums for multival condition field.. Accepted values are `post_parameter`, `query_parameter`, `request_cookie`, `request_header`, `response_header`, and `signal`.

groupOperator.description: Logical operator for the group. Accepted values are `any` and `all`.

operator.description: Indicates whether the supplied conditions will check for existence or non-existence of matching field values. Accepted values are `exists` and `does_not_exist`.

operator.description: Operator to apply (e.g., `equals`, `contains`).

value.description: The value to test the field against.

immediate.description: Ignore thresholds and block immediately when at least one attack signal is detected. Default value `false`.

oneHour.description: The one-hour interval threshold. Minimum 1 and maximum 10,000. Default value 100.

oneMinute.description: The one-minute interval threshold. Minimum 1 and maximum 10,000. Default value 1.

tenMinutes.description: The ten-minute interval threshold. Minimum 1 and maximum 10,000. Default value 60.

allowInteractive.description: Specifies if interaction is allowed (used when `type = browser_challenge`).

deceptionType.description: specifies the type of deception (used when `type = deception`).

signal.description: Signal name to exclude (used when `type = exclude_signal`).

type.description: The action type. One of: `add_signal`, `allow`, `block`, `browser_challenge`, `dynamic_challenge`, `exclude_signal`, `verify_token` or for rate limit rule valid values: `log_request`, `block_signal`, `browser_challenge`, `verify_token`

operator.description: Operator to apply (e.g., `equals`, `contains`).

value.description: The value to test the field against.

operator.description: Operator to apply (e.g., `equals`, `contains`).

value.description: The value to test the field against.

conditions.description: A list of nested conditions in this list.

field.description: Enums for multival condition field.. Accepted values are `post_parameter`, `query_parameter`, `request_cookie`, `request_header`, `response_header`, and `signal`.

groupOperator.description: Logical operator for the group. Accepted values are `any` and `all`.

operator.description: Operator to apply (e.g., `equals`, `contains`).

clientIdentifiers.description: List of client identifiers used for rate limiting. Can only be length 1 or 2.

duration.description: Duration in seconds for the rate limit.

interval.description: Time interval for the rate limit in seconds. Accepted values are 60, 600, and 3600.

signal.description: Reference ID of the custom signal this rule uses to count requests.

threshold.description: Rate limit threshold. Minimum 1 and maximum 10,000.

name.description: Name for the Client Identifier.

type.description: Type of the Client Identifier. Accepted values are `ip`, `post_parameter`, `request_cookie`, `request_header`, and `signal_payload`.

id.description: The unique ID of the entry

ip.description: An IP address that is the focus for the ACL

negated.description: A boolean that will negate the match if true

subnet.description: An optional subnet mask applied to the IP address

address.description: An IPv4, hostname, or IPv6 address for the Backend

betweenBytesTimeout.description: How long to wait between bytes in milliseconds. Default `10000`

connectTimeout.description: How long to wait for a timeout in milliseconds. Default `1000`

errorThreshold.description: Number of errors to allow before the Backend is marked as down. Default `0`

firstByteTimeout.description: How long to wait for the first bytes in milliseconds. Default `15000`

healthcheck.description: Name of a defined `healthcheck` to assign to this backend

keepaliveTime.description: How long in seconds to keep a persistent connection to the backend between requests.

maxConn.description: Maximum number of connections for this Backend. Default `200`

maxTlsVersion.description: Maximum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

minTlsVersion.description: Minimum allowed TLS version on SSL connections to this backend.

name.description: Name for this Backend. Must be unique to this Service. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

overrideHost.description: The hostname to override the Host header

port.description: The port number on which the Backend responds. Default `80`

preferIpv6.description: Prefer IPv6 connections to origins for hostname backends. Default `true`

shareKey.description: Value that when shared across backends will enable those backends to share the same health check.

shield.description: The POP of the shield designated to reduce inbound load. Valid values for `shield` are included in the `GET /datacenters` API response

sslCertHostname.description: Configure certificate validation. Does not affect SNI at all

sslCheckCert.description: Be strict about checking SSL certs. Default `true`

sslCiphers.description: Cipher list consisting of one or more cipher strings separated by colons. Commas or spaces are also acceptable separators but colons are normally used.

sslClientCert.description: Client certificate attached to origin. Used when connecting to the backend

sslClientKey.description: Client key attached to origin. Used when connecting to the backend

sslSniHostname.description: Configure SNI in the TLS handshake. Does not affect cert validation at all

useSsl.description: Whether or not to use SSL to reach the Backend. Default `false`

weight.description: The [portion of traffic](https://docs.fastly.com/en/guides/load-balancing-configuration#how-weight-affects-load-balancing) to send to this Backend. Each Backend receives weight / total of the traffic. Default `100`

forceDestroy.description: Allow the dictionary to be deleted, even if it contains entries. Defaults to false.

name.description: A unique name to identify this dictionary. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the dictionary, and discard the current items in the dictionary

writeOnly.description: If `true`, the dictionary is a [private dictionary](https://docs.fastly.com/en/guides/private-dictionaries). Default is `false`. Please note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the dictionary, and discard the current items in the dictionary. `fastly.ServiceVcl` resource will only manage the dictionary object itself, and items under private dictionaries can not be managed using [`fastly.ServiceDictionaryItems`](https://registry.terraform.io/providers/fastly/fastly/latest/docs/resources/service_dictionary_items#limitations) resource. Therefore, using a write-only/private dictionary should only be done if the items are managed outside of Terraform

comment.description: An optional comment about the Domain.

name.description: The domain that this Service will respond to. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource.

checkInterval.description: How often to run the Healthcheck in milliseconds. Default `5000`

expectedResponse.description: The status code expected from the host. Default `200`

headers.description: Custom health check HTTP headers (e.g. if your health check requires an API key to be provided).

host.description: The Host header to send for this Healthcheck

httpVersion.description: Whether to use version 1.0 or 1.1 HTTP. Default `1.1`

initial.description: When loading a config, the initial number of probes to be seen as OK. Default `3`

method.description: Which HTTP method to use. Default `HEAD`

name.description: A unique name to identify this Healthcheck. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

threshold.description: How many Healthchecks must succeed to be considered healthy. Default `3`

timeout.description: Timeout in milliseconds. Default `5000`

window.description: The number of most recent Healthcheck queries to keep for this Healthcheck. Default `5`

allowVideo.description: Enables GIF to MP4 transformations on this service.

jpegQuality.description: The default quality to use with JPEG output. This can be overridden with the "quality" parameter on specific image optimizer requests.

jpegType.description: The default type of JPEG output to use. This can be overridden with "format=bjpeg" and "format=pjpeg" on specific image optimizer requests. Valid values are `auto`, `baseline` and `progressive`. - auto: Match the input JPEG type, or baseline if transforming from a non-JPEG input. - baseline: Output baseline JPEG images - progressive: Output progressive JPEG images

name.description: Used by the provider to identify modified settings. Changing this value will force the entire block to be deleted, then recreated.

resizeFilter.description: The type of filter to use while resizing an image. Valid values are `lanczos3`, `lanczos2`, `bicubic`, `bilinear` and `nearest`. - lanczos3: A Lanczos filter with a kernel size of 3. Lanczos filters can detect edges and linear features within an image, providing the best possible reconstruction. - lanczos2: A Lanczos filter with a kernel size of 2. - bicubic: A filter using an average of a 4x4 environment of pixels, weighing the innermost pixels higher. - bilinear: A filter using an average of a 2x2 environment of pixels. - nearest: A filter using the value of nearby translated pixel values. Preserves hard edges.

upscale.description: Whether or not we should allow output images to render at sizes larger than input.

webp.description: Controls whether or not to default to WebP output when the client supports it. This is equivalent to adding "auto=webp" to all image optimizer requests.

webpQuality.description: The default quality to use with WebP output. This can be overridden with the second option in the "quality" URL parameter on specific image optimizer requests.

accountName.description: The google account name used to obtain temporary credentials (default none). Not required if 'email' and 'secret_key' are provided. You may optionally provide this via an environment variable, `FASTLY_GCS_ACCOUNT_NAME`.

dataset.description: The ID of your BigQuery dataset

email.description: The email for the service account with write access to your BigQuery dataset. If not provided, this will be pulled from a `FASTLY_BQ_EMAIL` environment variable

name.description: A unique name to identify this BigQuery logging endpoint. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

processingRegion.description: Region where logs will be processed before streaming to BigQuery. Valid values are 'none', 'us' and 'eu'.

projectId.description: The ID of your GCP project

secretKey.description: The secret key associated with the service account that has write access to your BigQuery table. If not provided, this will be pulled from the `FASTLY_BQ_SECRET_KEY` environment variable. Typical format for this is a private key in a string with newlines

table.description: The ID of your BigQuery table

accountName.description: The unique Azure Blob Storage namespace in which your data objects are stored

compressionCodec.description: The codec used for compression of your logs. Valid values are zstd, snappy, and gzip. If the specified codec is "gzip", gzip_level will default to 3. To specify a different level, leave compression_codec blank and explicitly set the level using gzip_level. Specifying both compression_codec and gzip_level in the same API request will result in an error.

container.description: The name of the Azure Blob Storage container in which to store logs

fileMaxBytes.description: Maximum size of an uploaded log file, if non-zero.

gzipLevel.description: Level of Gzip compression from `0-9`. `0` means no compression. `1` is the fastest and the least compressed version, `9` is the slowest and the most compressed version. Default `0`

messageType.description: How the message should be formatted. Can be either `classic`, `loggly`, `logplex` or `blank`. Default is `classic`

name.description: A unique name to identify the Azure Blob Storage endpoint. It is important to note that changing this attribute will delete and recreate the resource

path.description: The path to upload logs to. Must end with a trailing slash. If this field is left empty, the files will be saved in the container's root path

period.description: How frequently the logs should be transferred in seconds. Default `3600`

processingRegion.description: Region where logs will be processed before streaming to BigQuery. Valid values are 'none', 'us' and 'eu'.

publicKey.description: A PGP public key that Fastly will use to encrypt your log files before writing them to disk

sasToken.description: The Azure shared access signature providing write access to the blob service objects. Be sure to update your token before it expires or the logging functionality will not work

Valid values are `lanczos3`, `lanczos2`, `bicubic`, `bilinear` and `nearest`. - lanczos3: A Lanczos filter with a kernel size of 3. Lanczos filters can detect edges and linear features within an image, providing the best possible reconstruction. - lanczos2: A Lanczos filter with a kernel size of 2. - bicubic: A filter using an average of a 4x4 environment of pixels, weighing the innermost pixels higher. - bilinear: A filter using an average of a 2x2 environment of pixels. - nearest: A filter using the value of nearby translated pixel values. forceDestroy.description: Services that are active cannot be destroyed. In order to destroy the Service, set `force_destroy` to `true`. Default `false`

forceRefresh.description: Used internally by the provider to temporarily indicate if all resources should call their associated API to update the local state. This is for scenarios where the service version has been reverted outside of Terraform (e.g. via the Fastly UI) and the provider needs to resync the state for a different active version (this is only if `activate` is `true`).

imported.description: Used internally by the provider to temporarily indicate if the service is being imported, and is reset to false once the import is finished

name.description: The unique name for the Service to create

See Fastly's documentation on [Compute](https://developer.fastly.com/learning/compute/)

fastly:index/tlsMutualAuthentication:Tls.description: The Mutual TLS API allows for client-to-server authentication using client-side X.509 authentication. The main Mutual Authentication object represents the certificate bundle and other configurations which support Mutual TLS for your domains. Mutual TLS can be added to existing TLS activations to allow for client-to-server authentication. In order to use mutual TLS, you must already have active server-side TLS using either custom certificates or an enabled Fastly-managed subscription. The examples below demonstrate how to use Mutual Authentication along with a TLS Subscription. Refer to the `fastly.TlsSubscription` resource documentation for a deeper explanation of that code.

certBundle.description: One or more certificates. Enter each individual certificate blob on a new line. Must be PEM-formatted.

createdAt.description: Date and time in ISO 8601 format.

enforced.description: Determines whether Mutual TLS will fail closed (enforced) or fail open. A true value will require a successful Mutual TLS handshake for the connection to continue and will fail closed if unsuccessful. A false value will fail open and allow the connection to proceed (if this attribute is not set we default to `false`).

include.description: A comma-separated list used by the Terraform provider during a state refresh to return more data related to your mutual authentication from the Fastly API (permitted values: `tls_activations`).

name.description: A custom name for your mutual authentication. If name is not supplied we will auto-generate one.

tlsActivations.description: List of alphanumeric strings identifying TLS activations.
